reviewText:
I finally got Echo of Soul to work and wasn't too impressed. I only played one class up to level 9 to at least give it a chance, but it didn't hold out.

Playing to Game

In order to actually play this game, I downloaded it through Steam, only to have to download it again from the game's actual website. After transfering some files, the game could be played through Steam. If you're interested in checking this game out for yourself, a walkthrough on how to play it through Steam can be found at the following link. Just click on Getting EoS to work through Steam" on the right hand side.
http://steamcommunity.com/app/290140#scrollTop=1900

Character "Creation"

First
date: is the classes. I'm not overly fond of classes after some of the other mmo's I've played where you can use any (or most) of the skills
hoursPlayed: etc. If you don't care whether a game has classes or not
voteText: then go ahead and disregard this one
helpfulPercent: it's just a personal thing for me.\n\nSecond
votesHelpful: classes are gender locked. Every warrior is a big
votesTotal: muscular dude with a big sword. Every rouge is a lithe dude who looks like a kid. Every mage is a little girl. You can customize their hair
votesFunny: eyes
commentsCount: face
column16: the colors
column18: and that's all free (at least at creation. I don't know if you can change it later or not). To me
column19:
this is picking a character to play and customizing their appearance a little.

Quests

To be completely honest
column20: I skipped over the dialouge portion of the quests
column21: so I don't have any story other than cutscenes and bosses. I found the quests to be lackluster. Even the MMO's I do like have some of this
column22: but the quests seemed to be sending me to talk to someone
column25: each quest was only one task long. While this does get you to the reward faster
column28: is just too simple. I faced
column30: two bosses before I was level 8
column31: and that was solo. (that could possibly be a balancing issue
column32: or it could just be simplicity itself).\n\nNew
column33: better equipment for your class is also given away as quest rewards. While this is useful in saving money and not having to bother with shops (I didn't even look at those)
column34: it further simplifies the game. If you ever have to use a shop
column35:
it'd probably be to sell things and clean out your inventory. Everything you need is given to you when you need it.

Skills

Again
column38: so I don't have all of the details on this. What I did notice is that your skills are automatically learned and hotkeyed as you level. This does remove the hassle of picking out skills each level
column39: but it also removes the ability to customize your class and play the way you like. Then again
column40: you could just not use the skills you don't care for
column41: but why have them anyway? I'm fine with getting preset skills in other RPG's
column42: but I prefer to customize my MMO characters
column45:
or skills.

Cash Shop

Many free to play mmo's have this
column46: so I'm not going to complain about it too much. They do have to make money somehow. However
column47: there is at least one quest
column49: where you are to buy something from the cash shop. You are able to abandon the quest
column50: but there'll always be a marker in the second town for a quest you haven't done
column51:
because you haven't paid for it.

Graphics

The graphics were good
column52: I won't complain about those. Characters and terrain are beautiful
column53: monsters are appropirately hideous. This is a good 3D environment
column54: with good character models. I experienced no lag at any point while I was playing. (Don't ask what my settings were at
column55:
I never checked.) The graphics may actually be the only thing I actually like about this game.

Conclusion

I wasn't very impressed as the game took too much effort to be able to work for a rather generic
column56: simple mmorpg. There are some elements that are unique
column57: but the overall gameplay reminds me of just about every other mmo I've played without the challenges. I didn't browse any shops
column59: or anything like that. I had no need to check a shop for new equipment
column60: and I've never been overly fond of pvp. If you'd like to give it a try yourself
column61: the link to get it to work through steam is provided above and again below. Just click "Getting EoS to work through Steam" on your right.\nhttp://steamcommunity.com/app/290140#scrollTop=1900"

reviewText: Pretty good game, honestly the first MMORPG in a while to actually keep me interested, the PvP is pretty fun, a bit unbalanced at the moment, but /we are just in the baby stages/ of Open Beta, as the game just launched about a month or so ago. Kill mobs for souls, or gain them through PvP then purify them to be able to choose from 4 unique soul skills you can use in PvP, PvE, etc. Overall I recommend this game, if you're looking for a pretty good MMORPG to play, it's not the best in the world, but it's also far from the worst. Remember the game JUST launched into Open Beta, NEW Content, Fixes, etc will be added in the future, over time.

reviewText:
I actually had fun for a while with this one. I know, I was surprised too.

The RPG elements are quite simplistic, but I've seen worse. At Level 10, you have to choose a path for your class. Once you've selected a path, every few levels you'll get to choose a new spell, so there is some class customization here. Note: there is no healer class and the five classes are gender-locked. I know this can be a letdown for some people.

The game is pretty addicting for a while, because you always have something to do, and leveling up is exciting because you always have new spells to look forward to. You get better gear frequently, you keep fighting new monsters and you never stay in the same region for too long.

Also, the graphics are surprisingly pleasing to look at. This game has some really good animations and sound effects, and plenty of different clothes too.

As for the general gameplay, it's pretty basic but the controls feel right, and you can even jump! The interface is easy to understand and isn't bloated. Even the little bit of PvP that I tried was enjoyable, since everyone's HP scales up to make it fair for everyone.

This game does get repetitive, but overall, it's enjoyable if you just want to grind for a while. It's not the kind of MMO that I would recommend playing for several hundreds of hours, but that doesn't make it bad.

reviewText:
I will give a personal experience of this MMO.

First off, the graphics, in my opinion, were very good. Animation looked nice, presented well. If I were to give any criticism to the aspect of looks, it would be the UI. A lot of MMO's suffer a clutter of menus, chat boxes, maps, lists, and this one is no real exception. But with a bit of tinkering, you can get your layout a bit less cluttered, so it isn't a real problem.

Second, the system. I feel this is an average system. Much of what I saw didn't surprise me, but it worked well enough. It's in fact simpler than a lot of MMO's, when it comes to upgrading equipment, purchasing and selling on the marketplace, etc. You'll get a hang of it quite quickly with the right intelligence.

Combat was actually pretty well constructed, however, I do feel that fighting isn't very satisfying. Is it balanced? I feel in both PVP and PVE, the devs constructed it well enough to avoid too much inbalance. BUT, there is a catch that comes later... (see final paragraphs)

Third, is it a fun MMO? I would say yes, but only to a point. The quests, as I expected going into this game, repeated themselves. A lot. I mean... a lot. Each time you wish to get to a new exciting area, there's this connecting path that will look the same, and will take you a good half hour to get through.

The rewards for questing and adventuring are dull. Very dull. The best you'll get is a choice of either weapon A or weapon B. You get the one tailored to your Class skill tree. Done. Next repeat quest, ahoy! Rinse and repeat.

At level 60 (cap) this game changes dramatically. If you were to go into PVP at level 60 with your new shiny level 60 equipment, expect to get MASSACERED. All of a sudden, you feel very weak. You have all these things to do, all the PVE grinding quests, dungeons, hunting grounds, farming, that it's all just too much. This is where I stopped playing.

I tried to be a level 60, I tried. I even looked up a guide on HOW TO PLAY A LVL 60. The fact I had to do this, in my opinion, brought my rating for this game to 'eenope'. Frankly, it requires so much devotion of time, so much effort, getting shouted at by other players about doing things wrong. It isn't worth the dungeons, wings, and shiny equipment. Just don't bother. It'll suck the life out of you.

In conclusion, this game can be fun, for a time. But I do not recommend it's worth anymore than a test play.

reviewText:
TL, DR: Best RPG MMO on the current market.

Hi guys,

I was searching for a long time a 'good old style' MMO RPG since the Guild Wars 1 has been abandoned. All of the others caused disappointment. But this is just as an RPG MMO should be, nothing special, but everything fit.

Pros:
-good combat system, skill based, so you have to use your brain, but thanks for the popping up Q and E skills it is still dinamic.
-a lot of very simple but very good solution, like: you can change the graphics settings just by two clicks (literaly), for example in PVE area you keep it on max, but when you join PVP you can choose a lower setting to eliminate the unnecessary shining things and get extra FPS when needed.
-although the questes are quite tipical, but some NPC are really funny, if you read the text of the questes.
-graphics is good while it is still running well on older PCs too.
-Set for European mind: Odin, Gehenna,... the anime feeling is very small.
-good crafting system but you are not forced to craft if you do not want: in this case you can choose the resource gatherer profession and get money on it.
-according to my experience it is NOT pay to win.
-community is helpful and they tipically can behave on an adult way

Cons:
-too fast respawn, sometimes you have not even the chance to get the loot and the mob is already there again.
-lack of dedicated healer profession
-sex locked preofessions, but it is not a big problem, professions generally fit for the sex (male warrior, female sorceress,...)

Overall, it's obvious that it has been created by an MMO-experienced team.

reviewText:
Aeria Games has a crappy system of connecting you account to steam. Meaning, once you connect one accout with steam,  its permanant so i couldnt link my other account -_- Aside from that, I love the game soo much.

Pros
- Its not a P2W game, Meaning you have to spend time to earn the OP gear
- Easy to learn and if you know know how to use your class, you can Dominate
- Everybody has a chance to kill each other, sure the higher level you are in pvp arenas the better you can kill but ultamatly, they try there best to even it out. (Ex. i was level 14 mage, was ranked 8 in pvp arena)
- I love how simple the MMORPG
- Some class may be weak in the beggining but later in the higher levels, you can be really helpful later on

Cons
- The MMORPG maybe to simple for you
- Still fairly new so it wont have much as in Outfit and assesories (im into that :D
- Some classes may not be OP in the beggining

8/10   All the loli's you could have :D

reviewText:
This games is amazing but it has it's pros and cons.
Pros:
-The game is Free to Play you can get the best gear by just playing so it's not a P2W as some of you state. You can only buy headwear and so on in the store but NOT some kind of boosts or anything.
-Decent graphics
-The dungeons are well desinged in my opinion.
-There are tons of quests so they can keep you busy for quite a long time(1000+ quests)
-It's very friendly to new MMORPG players
-I like it that you can control the sound beetwen the storytelling screen.
Cons:
AERIA GAMES I would rate this game 8/10.

reviewText:
This is a great F2P game. The graphics are nice, the gameplay feels fresh, and the world is pretty large.
The game isn't an easy walk in the park; with solo-dungeons being nearly impossible at the level they are unlocked (2 lvls above unlock is recomended).
While there is a cash store, it doesn't feel as if it intrudes upon the game in a signifigant way compared to other games.
Lots of quests keep the player busy, searching for new gear and lands to explore.
The PVP is great for a new F2P game, with players being able to enter the battlefield at lvl 10. More content is being developed, and I intend to keep playing this game.
A great RPG with professions, lots of gear, wide variety of enemies, numerous dungeons, periodic boss spawns in the open world, guild and guild wars, and battlefields make this a game worth the time to check out.
And all of it is FREE!

reviewText:
I am honestly surprised by this game, while it doesn't exactly shine in graphics or feel the most modern and polished mmo I have played. I find myself enjoying it a lot. Especially the PvP battlefields, they are fast paced generally capture point driven and combat is relatively balanced regardless of your level. (annoying stunlock still occurs, but that's every mmo I've ever played) It's free, there is a cash shop but I've found absolutely no need to actually use it, it's completely voluntary the way it is set up, and lets be honest if you put more than 20 hours into a game you should chip a few bucks the way of the company that provided it. Another feature I like is the ability to solo dungeons, it's doable as pretty much any class and any level. You can get all the gear in the game and never party up if that's the way you want to do things. You can also of course party up, the strangest mechanic there is there is no dedicated healer class in this game. It takes some getting used to. They compensate for that by making potions, revives, and heal scrolls easily and cheaply obtainable at the npc in game shops. I could go on for awhile but despite a lot of complaining and bad reviews I found myself considering this a good game, and will likely give it even more time, and maybe even spend a few bucks on that cash shop just to show my appreciation. Usually these korean cross over mmo's aren't very enjoyable, but this one reminds me of what WoW used to be before they turned it into the lowest common denominator crap that it is now.


I highly suggest giving the game a few days and 20-40 levels to make an impression on you. If you can see past it not having the greatest graphics I'm pretty sure you'll find yourself enjoying it. Even though the server populations aren't very high right now, battlefield pvp and dungeon searches usually take only a minute or two and the more the merrier.

reviewText:
A lot of the negative reviews I have been reading are all to do with launch issues. Fair enough, this MMORPG will not appeal to everybody but none do (including WoW). This is a F2P game and by no means pay to win. Of course it is possible to level faster and gain weapons/armour sooner if you pay (as I have) but it is just as easy to unlock it. Crafters will be rewarded much more than those who pay and the auction house is a great way of getting some cheap gear.

If you are looking for a great, free game to sink a couple of hundred hours into then this is one to try.

Also, the only reason that I don't have much game time is because I do not play this game via Steam!

reviewText:
I have to say this has to be one of the best games I've played in a long time. I love it and it isn't as annoying to level up in as compared to games like Lord of the Rings Online. The way it is set up is simple and comfortable to use and in my opinion blows most games away. There are a lot of quests to do and they are pretty simple and short to do compared to quests in games like RuneScape that can take hours even days to complete.

Echo of Souls reminds me a lot of the game Rapelz which is a game I played a lot before getting a new computer and was never able to find again. It is easy to get engrossed into this game and hard to walk away from. This MMORPG is definately one I'd recommened to new gamers as well as veteran gamers. The graphics are impressive and the game runs smoothly. The only problem I can see is the fact that the 5 choices of charector tipes are gender locked, but that doesn't really decrease how much I like this game.

I'd like to thank the people who made it for bringing such an awesome game into existance.

reviewText:
As you can see I only have about 10 hours playtime on Echo of Soul. I personally really enjoy this game, though admittedly it's nothing different or unique. However, I do recommend it:

Pros
+Large and friendly population (And it seems to be growing from what early players have told me)
+Rewarding combat and there is a need to roll to dodge attacks being charged up by enemies.
+Rewarding 15vs15 PvP from level 10+ (You play pvp with players from level 10 - 60 all in one game. Everyones stats are scaled to level 60 to balance out the gameplay.)
+A very large world, especially for a new game, with currently 0 expansions or level cap raises.
+Pretty game, the graphics are dated but it's still visually gorgeous.
+Levelling isn't too slow or too fast. I reached level 25 in 10 hours. (Remember the level cap is 60)
+Group dungeons from level 35+.
+Innovative and interesting soul collection system.
+Professions
+Can choose one of two paths for each class at level 10. (Beserker or Protector Warrior for example)

Cons
-Rather generic, nothing we haven't seen before. (Though for some reason I enjoy this game a lot more than many similar titles.)
-No innovative classes.
-Gender locked classes.

If you are looking for a fun, polished and rewarding MMORPG with a large, active community, I highly recommend this game.

reviewText:
I am honestly surprised by this game, while it doesn't exactly shine in graphics or feel the most modern and polished mmo I have played. I find myself enjoying it a lot. Especially the PvP battlefields, they are fast paced generally capture point driven and combat is relatively balanced regardless of your level. (annoying stunlock still occurs, but that's every mmo I've ever played) It's free, there is a cash shop but I've found absolutely no need to actually use it, it's completely voluntary the way it is set up, and lets be honest if you put more than 20 hours into a game you should chip a few bucks the way of the company that provided it. Another feature I like is the ability to solo dungeons, it's doable as pretty much any class and any level. You can get all the gear in the game and never party up if that's the way you want to do things. You can also of course party up, the strangest mechanic there is there is no dedicated healer class in this game. It takes some getting used to. They compensate for that by making potions, revives, and heal scrolls easily and cheaply obtainable at the npc in game shops. I could go on for awhile but despite a lot of complaining and bad reviews I found myself considering this a good game, and will likely give it even more time, and maybe even spend a few bucks on that cash shop just to show my appreciation. Usually these korean cross over mmo's aren't very enjoyable, but this one reminds me of what WoW used to be before they turned it into the lowest common denominator crap that it is now.


I highly suggest giving the game a few days and 20-40 levels to make an impression on you. If you can see past it not having the greatest graphics I'm pretty sure you'll find yourself enjoying it. Even though the server populations aren't very high right now, battlefield pvp and dungeon searches usually take only a minute or two and the more the merrier.

reviewText:
First I gotta say that I enjoy the game and like playing it.  Nothing new or special really but that doesn't detract from playing the game for me which is why I recommend it.  The issues I have with the game don't break the game and make it unplayable and are more just annoyances.

My only real issues with the game are that your limited on inventory space if you don't want to pay irl cash for the large bags to increase your space.  You can get 5 extra bags that have 6 slots on in them from questing but any more then that and you gotta buy them and you don't really make in game currency all that fast or at least I haven't.

My other issue is with the professions.  You can have 2 secondary professions which are cooking and soul expert, but you can only have one of the 3 main professions. So you can get resource gathering which as it sounds you just gather resourses and do nothing with them.  The other two are alchemy and jewel crafting.  Note that the issue is that without resourse gathering you can't get the items you would need for the other two professions.  So you can't work on the crafting professions without help and the gathering one juse leaves you with a bunch of resources you can't do anything with besides sell them since you don't have the inventory or stash space to hold onto them for when you replace the gathering profession with a crafting one.

Like I said I still enjoy the game and enjoy playing it but those points just bother me and make the main professions not worth your time to do unless you have a friend who can do the gathering portion for you or you can gather resources for a friend to use.  If not go with the gathering profession and then sell your mats to other users.

reviewText: Echo of Souls is a free to play MMORPG that shares a number of similiarities with World of Warcraft, but also offers a fair bit of differences to World of Warcraft.  While it is not extraordinarily good, it isn't too terrible, either.  I recommend that people are who interested in MMORPGs to at least give this a try.\n\nThe story and lore of Echo of Souls is little more than just for the sake of being there".  The major conflict centers around a mysterious evil force that seeks to get the mcguffin in order to fulfill their nefarious deeds.  The lore is influenced by Norse mythology
date: but it seems to be mostly the same generic
hoursPlayed: go save it." without much developement or depth to it.  You play as a typical hero who wants to stop the evil dudes and save the day.\n\nThe combat in this game will feel clunky at first.  You are not able to move while using abilities (even if they are instant)
voteText: resource generators are minimal at low levels (but get better as you gain levels and abilities)
helpfulPercent: and your abilities use a fair amount of resources causing downtime more often than not until you unlock additional resource generators.  As you gain levels
votesHelpful: the combat will speed up and feel natural
votesTotal: but never to the point where it will be completely smooth and freeflowing due to the lack of movement while in the animation of an ability.\n\nThe PvE portion of the game is the typical "collect 5 bear asses and turn them in" for the most part
votesFunny: but the monotony is mixed in with interesting diversity in content.  Co-op bosses which are powerful enemies that spawn in zones.  Upon spawning
commentsCount: all players in the area and incoming in the area while the boss is still alive will recieve a quest to kill it.  The tag is shared across all parties
column16: allowing all players in the zone to fight the powerful enemy together
column17: even if they aren't in the same party.  There are also party bosses which require a group in order to take down.  Collecting chaos souls
column19: and can be converted into purified souls which grant you bursts of power for a short amount of time.\n\nThe instances in this game are split into solo
column21: and 10/25 man raids.  Solo dungeons are fairly easy dungeons that teach you the typical mechanics of the bosses in the game which are usually in the form of "don't stand in circles" and "don't stand near the boss when he spins" and "kill adds".  They are a nice touch to the game
column22: but the lack of pre-cap party dungeons is disappointing (there is only 1 available at 35).\n\nThe lack of a holy trinity does not interfere with the PvE aspects of the game.  Healing is mostly done through the use of healing scrolls and potions while in combat and bandages out of combat.  The former are items that heal a party member instantly and yourself over a short period of time
column23: respectively.  The bandages act like food items in World of Warcraft.\n\nThe PvP content of this game is below average.  The lack of a holy trinity combined with the inability to move while in an ability's animation greatly improves the ability for melee classes to be able to tunnel down ranged classes.  However
column24: ranged classes that are not tunneled down can easily shred enemy players due to the sheer amount of damage they are able to put out while remaining still.  Ranged classes don't have very much escape options besides the roll button
column25: either.  Melee classes also risk being obliterated the moment they charge in due to lack of defensive cooldowns.\n\nOverall
column26: the PvP content seems to be in a strange place and I don't really know what can be done about it.  It's not terrible
column27: but something about it feels wrong.\n\nThere are no toys in this game to have fun with."

reviewText: I'd like to point out most of these reviews are by people with less than 20 hours played. I'm currently on my second steam due to my first having issues with infringment. But I'd like to say that being a max level player on this game with over 40 hours spent on max level pvp alone. This game does have it's imbalances but overall no matter what class you play the game is fun and fair. As someone who played WoW for 9 years and pretty much any other MMO RPG you can think of (rift, terra, allods, archeage, etc). This game is overall fun and more relaxed, less serious, and fun. I'd recommend this for anyone looking for an MMO RPG to kill time on. Remember though. Every game is a hit/miss for some people. So give it a shot and ignore the bad reviews!

reviewText:
For all those not wanting to read through my review... This game is 8/10....  ALSO PLEASE SCROLL ALL THE WAY DOWN TO THE BOTTOM TO READ SOME EASY LEVELING TIPS AND MAKIGN MONEY IN GAME
Now anyone who sees this game would easily say that this is a watered-down version of FF14,  however  , I beg to differ.
Echo of Soul (EOS) is a game that targets to make its own take on things. Beautiful worlds, great mechanics/ animations, and hours of addicting fun. The game is quite difficult proving that there are no healing roles whatsoever, so keeping a watch on your health bar is an absolute must. This game isn't so hard in the leveling process, as grinding is not really required. You don't rake up xp as much as you do grinding helpless creeps for hours but rather doing quests in a timely manner. This was done in order to make the player feel rewarded for their quests and accomplished for doing something to progress the game.  seriously though, do the quests

NO PAY TO WIN This game doesnt require pay to win at all. It was setup so that the player gets often rewarded for leveling up, questing, earning achievements,a nd also winning in pvp matches and gamemodes. The store only offers outfits" that are costumes for your characters and you can wear on them. These outfits have no effect but change only the outer appearance of what your character is wearing. All the armor can be found in game :)

ROLES/GAME The roles/classes each have their own unique abilities and feel to playing that you can easily tell each other apart. However
date: each class has 2 specific paths in which you can take in order to level your skills
recommended: giving the player the freedom to play how they want when they want.\nSpeaking of which
hoursPlayed: there are jewels that players can "inlay" into their equipment that give mighty buffs. Combining these jewels
voteText: if you have more than one
helpfulPercent: will boost the effects given to that jewel if it will be laid into the  specific piece of equipment.  confusing i know
votesHelpful: but its easy to understand when you see\nIn terms of  freedom  the roles are gender locked
votesTotal:
so you cant be a body-building girl warriror  sad i know.

DUNGEON/PVP This has a great dungeon and pvp aspect in the game that give both high risk and reward. If in any case you may die in a dungeon or in the world you would face a durability loss on equipment and would have to repair. PVP is different however in which you can die however many times you want and get either a consolation prize or a victory prize after the match. This has smart matching so you can do wahetevr you want while you wait.

Now for the tips
I cant stress this enough but just enjoy all the game for what it is. For easy levling do the daily quests for the pvp. You need to play 2 games (win or loss) and there. You get basically a level and lots of money. Money is a bit difficult to aqcuire in the game
votesFunny: but is super easy to buy and sell as everything
commentsCount:
and i mean EVERYTHING is 1 silver. (excluding all the rare stuff).

From completing the pvp you get either a consoloation jewelery box or a victory jewelery box depending if you lost or won. After open and i suggest you save those jewels to create greater ranking jewels. Selling a +5 dull ruby on the marketplace you can make an easy 75 gold.

I think those are good odds considering that 1
column16: 000 silver make 1 gold LOL\n\nAll in all
column17: a great game worth playing. Enjoy!"

date:

reviewText: I will catalog this review the best I can to get straight to the point in each topic I feel a person should know before they play this game. Overall I want to focus less on my experience on other MMO's I have played and tell you why I continue to play this one.\n\n1)Leveling-So as I said in my very brief Intro, I am going to get straight to the point and not fluff anything. Somethings about this game could be better, but most things work very well as are, and If its not broken dont fix it". Leveling in this game is hands down my least fave part of playing. I have 3 level 60 characters(Max Level) and I havn't enjoyed leveling a single one. I still love this game and heres why. This games content is tailored to level 60 characters
date: and leveling is a very repetative yet still fairly easy process if you just quest. Quest over and over. Doing battlefields will give you experience to level but only will make you level faster than questing if you have close to a 70% win rate. I say rush to max level as fast as you can.\n\n2)Guilds-Many players have a different opinion on who to make friends with (or not make friends with) and why. For many players they join a guild because it's mainly there nationality(Brazil Im talking to you). There are many guilds to choose from
recommended: and many guilds choose to fight monsters while many choose to fight players. I prefer to fight players so I picked a pvp guild and I still get to do just as many raids or dungeons as I would have had I not picked a pvp guild. Choose one early in the game to ask questions and make friends. Being in a guild is very rewarding and often helps you learn things the easy way rather than playing the game "in the dark".\n\n3)Gold becomes a thing of desire once you hit level 60. Gold is not needed in any way before level 60 if its your first character. If its your second character or later it can help you to get better gems which make leveling faster
hoursPlayed: but the game drops enough of them naturally you wont need to worry about it your first run through. Gold is your vehicle to get what you desire. EVERYTHING in this game that effects combat can be purchased with gold. You will have the fastest access to making gold in level 60 raids and dungeons. Or buy and sell goods on the market place if you study it before hand.\n\n4)Gems-Gems are extra items that attach to a players gear to make a player stronger(extra stats). They are a very important part of the game
voteText: but often highly over glorified. As a player with 3 level 60's I often play in pvp "gemless" and still compete just fine for MVP. This game isn't that hard if you always are trying to learn what you can do better in a given situation. Gems are luxury!!! Now dont ignore them 100%
helpfulPercent: they can be a great way to make gold
votesHelpful: and a great investment into becoming a stronger player. Far too many players blame their gems as the reason they are losing
votesTotal: when more importantly people with very good gems MOST of the time have better gems because they are better players
votesFunny: although I have beaten many players in flat 1v1 situations having worse gems. I have average gems because i refuse to spend money on this game. Hear that? Never spent a single penny.\n\n5)Dungeons-Dungeons before level 60 are very important and let me tell you what to do and what not to do. Before level 60 do the dungeons just to learn the in game mechanics on bosses
commentsCount: becuase the dungeons you see before level 60(or the bosses) you WILL see again. Focus more on improving as a player in dungeons
column16: than the gear. Going through the same dungeon before level 60 is a flat waste of time once you learn the mechanics. Yes it will give you good gear
column17: but I argue your gear would be better if you spend that same time questing into higher levels over farming a dungeon. NOW AT LEVEL 60
column18: the dungeons are good for gear
column19: and will start to bring a lot of gold. They drop gems and become a true test to your understanding of the game. Do not be upset if people lose their tempers with you in a level 60 dungeon. A lot of players are so used to the dungeons you may be new too
column20: that they dont understand why you are still learning the bosses. My best peice of advise
column21: let good friends or guild members take you to your first lv 60 dungeons to help you grow.\n\n6)Events-Now this game like many MMO's has holiday events. The events in this game so far are more community builders than actual content events
column22: although some events still bring exciting content into view. I argue this is something that Echo of Soul needs more focus on(Maybe through studying World of Warcraft events) But the EOS team has shown willingness to make this a larger part of the game
column23: and i think much more is to come.\n\n7)Reward Drops-Hands Down my least fave part of this game. Most items in this game are worth 1 silver to sell to a vendor. Yes
column25: I will not focus on that
column26: as much as what Im about to tell you. There is no world rare drop system as in other very fun MMO's. This is something I hope very dearly will enter this game. We need to be able to go into a raid with our friends or guild hoping to get a SPECIAL MOUNT or special item that is ONLY available in that spot. Just by creating a system where some high value items drop very rarely
column27: it creates a passion for players and a great enjoyment. A strong rare drop system allows people to actually feel rewarded for their time OUTSIDE of the personal satisfaction of completing a challenge. I love being challenged as much as the next person
column28: but when you already know you are smart enough to figure them out eventually
column29: a rare drop system keeps it very entertaining and exciting.\n\n8)Battleground-I have covered this a small amount already. Overall its just another way to test yourself. If you find yourself blaming your gems because you die
column31: it has partial truth. As a player who has been in a new players shoes
column32: I still owned the noobs. Some people can mentally handle the learning curve that will come your way
column33: and many run to excuses. Do the best you can and have fun! Try to learn and enjoy. There is 2 battlefields(3rd if you count Valhalla aka-guild war). Dont make excuses
column34: if you arnt doing well ask others how they play your class in pvp.\n\n9)PAY TO WIN?-FLAT ANSWER NO! This game is 100% NOT PAY TO WIN. You may ask me why I feel that way
column36: I have spent not a single amount of any type of real life currency on this game. I still can get beat
column37: but as an experienced player of this game
column38: I find when i get beat it was a result of my own failure of knowledge. Some players are going to be stronger than you
column39: maybe their class "counters" your class. Yes crazy idea I know. When you see a situation like this in battle its best to not fight the 1v1 you think you will lose. I know many good players who wont win a lot of 1v1's. They are viewed as good players because they know when they do and dont have the advantage
column40: and sometimes having your team with greater numbers is what it takes. Dont listen to anyone who says this game is Pay to Win
column41: its a scapegoat and quite frankly
column42: very poor excuse. This game can make your growth faster if you choose to pay
column43: but with that still comes a lot of risk. I know a lot of people who have spent money and not gotten any stronger for it. Think outside of the box and learn the game and the answers will come to you.\n\n10)Last Thought-I find this game to be the closest video game to a much loved anime called SAO. Now that has nothing to do with my love of this game. I personally enjoy testing myself
column44: which this game helps me do. And i love the vast majority of the community. Players here can be mean just like anywhere else
column45: but I have made friendships and I enjoy the time I spend playing. This game far surpasses the time I could spend watching TV or playing another video game."

reviewText:
This game....Aethestically its pleasing not anime themed. Movement is point and click. The skill system is decently thought out, and is a plus in this game. The combat is pretty fun. You get a mount early on in the game which is nice.

A problem with this game is the game progression. Each map there is a little exit portal at the end. If you are targeted by an enemy you are not allowed to leave that section of the map. So for one are there are like 8 sections that you need to progress through and after you go through a portal there is a super fast mini load. As you progress in the game its mainly kill and collect quests. Through quests you do not need to worry about getting new equipment or potions/scrolls to restore health/mana.

Another problem is that there are no stores or areas you can buy/sell stuff. All the loot gets accumulated in your inventory and there is nowhere to sell or buy stuff.  This entire time I have been playing there has only been one spot to sell/buy stuff and that was the beginning.

More problems incoming(O.O)...the classes are race and genderlocked. I do not think there are multiple races but the classes are genderlocked. I chose a gaurdian class and it was locked to be a female.

This game is not really a game I would continuously play. What stopped me from playing more is that there are no towns/merchants to sell my loot. So I have to pick and choose what to keep in my inventory.

reviewText: Despise the fact that I gave this game a negative rating its not bad, but it isnt good either. The main problem with this game is that its insanely generic. Most modern MMORPG's bring somthing new to the table while this doesnt. Its your average theme park MMO with tab target combat and fetch/kill quests. Other then the character models the game is ugly, the UI is bland and the environments look horrible. The reason I excluded the character models is because they actually look pretty nice and have a stylized design. I havent played much of this game but I've played enough to reilize how bland this game is.

reviewText:
Short but Honest Review.
Quit within the first HOUR

It's one of those MMO's that has annoying music and bad mechanics.

You click on an enemy once to fight it and there's nothing much else to do. Also who the hell even reads what the NPC's say? I couldn't focus or care for what story the lore had to offer with this dumb atmosphere Echo of Soul has. I can't tell if this game is TRYING to be quirky or bad . If I had to describe it in one word it would be Annoying." It's just an annoying game.

Don't play it

reviewText: Not terrible, but not good either. The graphics quality and framerate are both pretty low. The game also becomes pretty tedious due to its non-engaging story line. Basically you run around looking for a quest, kill a monster, turn it in, and repeat.  My largest complaint with this game is the movement system. Your viewpoint does not change when you turn left or right making you have to manually do it with your mouse. Also, you can't do this while you're walking or it will just go back to your previous viewpoint when you release your mouse. This makes gameplay pretty annoying.\n\nIt's free to play though, so there's no harm in checking it out for yourself if you really want to.

reviewText:
So I hate this game. The reasons why are as follows:
1. You cannot live up to your own promises regarding your Advanced" Character customization. Especially when you gender lock classes and you are too lazy to do hair physics for the majority of the 11 hairstyles you have available.
2. Peers have informed me that this game contains little to no worthwhile content before level 60.

For anyone looking for something that might be worth your time
date: try Arche Age. It might have flaws such as bugs and the economy (and of course the dreaded housing system) plus the quite obvious pay2win aspects including secondary currency and Patron status. But even then
recommended: the gameplay is dynamic and the classes are more versatile than any other game I've played. The Character customization is also absolutely STUNNING. It is very very well done with a PLETHORA of different options.\n\nEither way
hoursPlayed: this game is boring and not worth the space on my Harddrive. I reccomend looking somewhere else if you wanted a good MMORPG."

reviewText:
I've played a few hours already ang got to about level 20 and I think this is a very good game.  It reminds me a bit of Wow (World of Warcraft) with several things and that is great because I really enjoy that game.
Like all games it's not perfect and the worst thing with this game is the lack of variety/ customisation.  There are only a couple of quests at a time, only a few jobs/ hobbies available and you cannot customise your character that much in the form of choosing specific traits to improve like agility or critical strike chance etc. when you level up.
Also the matchmaking in PvP isa disaster because there are no level tiers and you can join a PvP match of mostly level 50s while you're only level 15.

It may seem that I dislike this game, but I listed the only 2 bad things I have noticed so far while I find everything else quite enjoyable.

reviewText:
I've been playing this on Ignite since Closed Beta and just wanted to give some feedback on what I've experienced whilst playing so far.

Pros
- Really lush environments (particularly from level 30-60)
- Can level through PVE + PVP
- Cool character style
- Really good specialization trees for classes
- Questing is kill 2/3 of these rather than 15-20
- Levelling is quik

Cons
- Maintenance can be long
- Some minor issues still need to be ironed out
- Starting zones are a bit boring
- Some issues with instancing

Meh
- Combat is tab targeting
- gender lock

All in all, there's a lot to sink your teeth into with EOS.

reviewText:
Good game, no tedious quests, because the main part of the game is party dungeoing and pvping, guild worldpvp and raids which have pvp features!

It's fun so far, sure there are a few cons. One of them is matchmaking on PvP. You can go PvP from level 10! But, be ready to go against 10-55 players. Which means that the team that has most low leved people will loose!
Because at lower levels in PvP you have less skills and less damage.

Wish it could go like 10-15, 16-21, 22-26 etc etc, but nah, it's all together and it makes really tedious times in PvP, lazy high level players do much less than low leveled players, which is pathetic. So your only hope is leveling up and have fun in PvP and higher levels!

You still can be useful in PvP at early levels but 50% of what a high lvl can do, example is that you cannot 1v1 a lvl 25+ as lvl 15. Unless they have half their hp off. :)

Overall i reccomend this game, hopefully they will add more options to matchmaking but questing wasn't tiring and im looking forward to the dungeons and pvp raids. It's still fresh and has a way to go.

Don't listen to most of the reviews as they complain about the game being from AeriaGames, don't get me wrong, I don't like AeriaGames either but it has the best monitization system from AeriaGames. Nothing is P2W so far. And hope it stays that way. It doesn't take long to level to 60 casually.

Be aware, it's like any other mmo out there, there is NO mmorpg that can feel as refreshing as your first ever mmorpg game, if it catches your attention for a while, good. If not, there's nothing to complain about because every mmorpg has done things everyone else did. :)

Have fun playing.

EU - Yggdrasil, Normie.

reviewText:
YouTube @ TheDailyDino

My MMO Overview for “Echo of Soul”

I participated in both the closed and open beta during May and played for about a week 1/2 in total, thus forming my thoughts about this game into a 6 ½ minute video provide below. While EoS is pretty generic at its core, the unique Soul System and heavy PvP focus gameplay might just be what some people were looking for

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KTBi9e4fyvc&list=PL3xkMBMpjkOV_lPF9DJA9x1-U7vjfyBg7

- 5 Classes, Each With 2 Unique Paths At lvl 10
- Skill Tree Unlocks @ lvl 10
- No Direct Healing Class
- 3 Professions (Resource Collector, jeweler, and Alchemist)
- Gem Crafting" System For Buffing Gear
- Unique "Soul System" For Buffs & Crafting
- Cooking System / More Buffs
- Create Guilds @ lvl 20
- 15v15 PvP @ lvl 10
- 5v5 PvP @ lvl 60
- Solo Dungeons @ lvl 10
- Party Dungeons @ lvl 35
- Infinite Dungeons @ lvl 60
- Solo Dungeons Drop Loot ONLY For Your Class
- Cosmetic Shop Pretty Fair (During Review)
- Small Zones / Lots Of Loading Screens
- Some OPTIONAL Quest Require Cash Shop Purchases -_-"

reviewText: I have played this game since early beta and have around 900 hours put into the game. I am currently 6/8  109 pvp items which currently makes the the best geared pvp sorc on any server outside of asia. I love this games pvp. But there is just not much to it. 2 battlegrounds and an arena system. My team got up to 1700 team rating and would spend hours in que just to get 1 match in becuase the developers didnt know how to set up a competent arena mmr system. The PVE is okay but nothing groundbreaking and there is not much to it at the moment. The serious lack of content has unfortunately caused me to steer people away from this game. I may change my stance if the next pvp patch greatly improves the state of things but I am not holding my breath. I currently have about 150 hours into skyforge and am loving the game so far. I would suggest giving that game a try over echo of soul as of september 15th 2015.\n\n-Skinnie ( requiem )

This game has gotten better, and from a ♥♥♥♥ company like Aeria they actually made this game GOOD. Something you don't see from Aeria, it's crazy! The game is litteraly not as P2W as it used to and the game feels so much better. Though the game is gender locked, that shouldn't be the issue why your not playing Echo Of Soul, the game is fun both solo or with groups while doing dungeons and raids.  I haven't tried the PVP but i heard it's bad, though everyone has their own opinons and i will be trying myself to see if it is actually good or bad.

To be honest, i hated it because others did but when i tried it myself i fell in love.  Just a tip, you should always try a game for yourself and don't hate a game just because others hate it, and that goes the same for liking a game, don't like it because others like it you don't have to if you don't want to.

Echo Of Soul is a fun MMORPG for beginners and veterans alike though some fetch quest and genderlock is included, bypassing that it's a decent MMORPG you should try out! ^-^

(I won't be giving a number rating on this game, mostly because i feel everyone game doesn't deserve to be determined as good or bad by a few numbers.)

reviewText:
An absolute travesty that blatantly tries to be Tera and fails miserably. It's got some strange mix of static vs action combat that doesn't work at all, because it's incredibly clunky and slow.

The art style looks like Tera. The UI elements look exactly like Tera. The characters look like Tera. Though the graphics have somehow managed to look terribly old. Just play Tera instead, because it's got a lot more to offer, ontop of a much better character creator (without the idiotic gender restrictions on classes) and is also F2P.

Yeah you read that right, the very few classes there are, are gender locked.

reviewText:
This game doesn't need bad reviews anymore. Here's a chocolate chip cookies recipe

Ingredients:
1 cup butter, softened
1 cup white sugar
1 cup packed brown sugar
2 eggs
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
3 cups all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
2 teaspoons hot water
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 cups semisweet chocolate chips
1 cup chopped walnuts

🍪 Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).
🍪 Cream together the butter, white sugar, and brown sugar until smooth. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the vanilla. Dissolve baking soda in hot water. Add to batter along with salt. Stir in flour, chocolate chips, and nuts. Drop by large spoonfuls onto ungreased pans.
🍪 Bake for about 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until edges are nicely browned.

How do I explain this game.... This is a grind.... and very boring alone.
The first time I played as a warrior with my friends. We got pretty far into the game and pushed through the endless grind of the same thing with different landscapes and we though we were doing pretty good.....Then we got to the capital city..................
And we knew we had a long way to go. We made a guild and set of to rid the land of which ever dark power threatened it this time.
1 week later we gave up and quit the game

I played as a guardian and looked like a ♥♥♥♥.
I played with koreans and they made me their ♥♥♥♥♥.
I sat there and thought about my life decisions.

Overall I think this is a good game that can be refined and developed more but you need friends to quench the grind
10/10 would waste life again

reviewText: Echo of Soul is an MMORPG that I have been stuck on for awhile now. The game is addictive! The game has amazing graphics, cool combat mechanics, beautiful scenery, cool-looking characters and of course a world of wonder and mystery to dive into! I'd say this is by far the best MMORPG that I've ever played! Never played WoW or LoL but I can bet that they are not as good or on par with Echo of Soul. The game is near-perfect! There are a few flaws in the game but nothing fundamentally killing its play value. I'd highly recommend this game to anyone who likes good MMORPGs and tactical real-time strategy games.

reviewText: I haven't played this game for very long, but it is long enough to be able to post an honest review\n\nThis game is really fun. Although the combat is monotonous, the community is amazing. There is no better experience than finding 3 or 4 players of your level and getting to know them while you quewst through the multitudes of areas. People say that the mini area idea with portals between each area is annoying or broken, but they're just being butthurt. I myself never had a problem with it. I usually play the rogue class, and I would say it's the most diifficult, (I've tried all 5) due to the fact that you need to learn combos to be able to do any real damage. Add to that the graphics are pretty good and the paying elements really don't affect you if you get them or not, and you have an amazing MMO all around.

reviewText:
I am writing this review while playing the game.

When I saw the game was like Tera I was really worried but what the heck, could be good.

Downloaded game, Launched it, Nothing happend. Went into task manager and force ended launcher, launched it agan and got lunch. Came back and launcher was up. Launcher said was loading patch, I opened warowl's livesteam, took 20 mins to load patch. When I created an account an error about the custom browser came up everytime it changed(more of an annoyance).

Game loaded fine, Loaded in windowed mode which was nice. only 1 server and it's not that active. Logged into server and created a character, laggy while switching between characters. The classes are gender AND race locked. This I was confused about but it is a new game so whatever. Created my character, There is no bald hairdo(why????) and very limited to the creation. I know the games creation doesn't matter but some people care about it. Especially hardcore MMO players do. Also the character naming doesn't allow spaces or periods.

Loaded character, the opening clip was pretty good. After it ended the first thing I see if login rewards, this is nice. Movement feels like WoW or Swtor, which is hold right click then attack with number keys only. Combat is a big sluggish but I am playing a rogue so it is a given. The UI is a bit in your face which is slightly annoying. The minimap could be smaller aswell as the toobar.

Combat like i said is sluggish, after playing for about 20 minutes i've gotten a bit used to it but it is still hard to get used to. playing some more and I can see myself playing this longer if I could get used to the combat.

To sum it all up:

Pros:

Combat system is very much like other popular MMOS but the abilites are strange for me.
Does not require a very powerful PC to run.
Classes are straight forward.
Small game download.
Daily rewards.

Cons:

Character creation is VERY limited.
The ingame tutorial does not help very much.
Only 1 server.
Very much like Tera.
UI is too big.

If you are a casual MMO player this game would be fun, If you play many MMOS and are competitive in them. I would wait atleast a year to get into it. The game lacks many competitive scenarios and it was only released a few months ago on steam. I give it a 7/10.

reviewText:
So besides the fact that there have been NUMEROUS main story quests I haven't been able to complete due to people at high levels (40+) spawn camping quest mobs so that they insta-kill them when they spawn in (there is no support for abusive behavior like that (or much else btw) as it doesn't break the TOS). Duel requests constantly flooding in from people at max level while you're just starting (can disable them thankfully as well as the constant stream of guild requests).

Basically support for this game is BS, high level players (not all) treat new players like S#!T, but it does have some decent graphics, a boring story, repetitive quests, a nice crafting system that is dependant on one another, and then the solo dungeons are also quite fun.

Overall the game is okay, nothing special really, just another grindfest MMO with bouncing boobs.

reviewText:
Never wrote a review before but had to write one for this game. So if you haven't watched any videos on the game play.. its a quest fest until lvl 60. And theres just too many inconvencies in the game such as not enough bag space and a major FLAW.. why does the game lag so much so often. It even says on the server status whilst logging in that the server is uncrowded. Yes its probably not a deal breaker but it has made my game play less enjoyable and is one of the reasonings I'm quitting. Anyway just going to make a list of sorts now..
Pros -
PvP is somewhat fun
Most items such as consumeables can be purchased for cheap in shops until lvl 60

Cons -
Way too much lag for a renowned company such as Aeria
Quest fest to the tee
Characters are gender locked...
No fun content until lvl 60 (admittely I haven't even tried any of the content after 60)
Way too much inconviences such as storage space

Overall.. Id probably give this game a 3/10. Honestly though even though the game isn't P2W since you can get enough gold.. It sure gives off that feel considering its Aeria games and they are a money grubbing company to the tee.

reviewText: Has a lot of potential but feels more like a cash grab by the developers.  Before you are even a few hours into the game there are already quests that require cash shop only items, quests are optional but it's never a good sign. PVP they do a decent job balancing the system which many other games fail to achieve. On the flip side they really lack some basic combat mechanics such as stun immunities (most games in the past 15 years have figured this out) which hinder smooth game play and detract from the positive things they have done with the PVP system. Player control is also very rough and not always responsive to what you intend to do, auto follow tends to over ride the player controls often running you into situations you would rather avoid.

reviewText:
Never wrote a review before but had to write one for this game. So if you haven't watched any videos on the game play.. its a quest fest until lvl 60. And theres just too many inconvencies in the game such as not enough bag space and a major FLAW.. why does the game lag so much so often. It even says on the server status whilst logging in that the server is uncrowded. Yes its probably not a deal breaker but it has made my game play less enjoyable and is one of the reasonings I'm quitting. Anyway just going to make a list of sorts now..
Pros -
PvP is somewhat fun
Most items such as consumeables can be purchased for cheap in shops until lvl 60

Cons -
Way too much lag for a renowned company such as Aeria
Quest fest to the tee
Characters are gender locked...
No fun content until lvl 60 (admittely I haven't even tried any of the content after 60)
Way too much inconviences such as storage space

Overall.. Id probably give this game a 3/10. Honestly though even though the game isn't P2W since you can get enough gold.. It sure gives off that feel considering its Aeria games and they are a money grubbing company to the tee.

reviewText:
I have this installed outside of steam so ignore my lack of hours. I don't always log into steam to play it.

This is a pretty alright game. Very simple and easy to get the hang of fast. The guild system is pretty nice. Each guild can be PvP or PvE friendly without jumping servers.
There are a TON of quests, but you don't have to do them all to get to max level. Also, when you do make it to max, there is still a lot more to do.

Sadly, as we all know, Aeria is one the money hungry side and will try to suck up as much money as they can. There are things they will entice you to buy. More time on your pets' lives, the ability to eat more food to get better buffs, so on and so forth.

All in all, not a bad game casual or not.

reviewText:
I am writing this review while playing the game.

When I saw the game was like Tera I was really worried but what the heck, could be good.

Downloaded game, Launched it, Nothing happend. Went into task manager and force ended launcher, launched it agan and got lunch. Came back and launcher was up. Launcher said was loading patch, I opened warowl's livesteam, took 20 mins to load patch. When I created an account an error about the custom browser came up everytime it changed(more of an annoyance).

Game loaded fine, Loaded in windowed mode which was nice. only 1 server and it's not that active. Logged into server and created a character, laggy while switching between characters. The classes are gender AND race locked. This I was confused about but it is a new game so whatever. Created my character, There is no bald hairdo(why????) and very limited to the creation. I know the games creation doesn't matter but some people care about it. Especially hardcore MMO players do. Also the character naming doesn't allow spaces or periods.

Loaded character, the opening clip was pretty good. After it ended the first thing I see if login rewards, this is nice. Movement feels like WoW or Swtor, which is hold right click then attack with number keys only. Combat is a big sluggish but I am playing a rogue so it is a given. The UI is a bit in your face which is slightly annoying. The minimap could be smaller aswell as the toobar.

Combat like i said is sluggish, after playing for about 20 minutes i've gotten a bit used to it but it is still hard to get used to. playing some more and I can see myself playing this longer if I could get used to the combat.

To sum it all up:

Pros:

Combat system is very much like other popular MMOS but the abilites are strange for me.
Does not require a very powerful PC to run.
Classes are straight forward.
Small game download.
Daily rewards.

Cons:

Character creation is VERY limited.
The ingame tutorial does not help very much.
Only 1 server.
Very much like Tera.
UI is too big.

If you are a casual MMO player this game would be fun, If you play many MMOS and are competitive in them. I would wait atleast a year to get into it. The game lacks many competitive scenarios and it was only released a few months ago on steam. I give it a 7/10.

reviewText:
How do I explain this game.... This is a grind.... and very boring alone.
The first time I played as a warrior with my friends. We got pretty far into the game and pushed through the endless grind of the same thing with different landscapes and we though we were doing pretty good.....Then we got to the capital city..................
And we knew we had a long way to go. We made a guild and set of to rid the land of which ever dark power threatened it this time.
1 week later we gave up and quit the game

My second time I tried to continue but I got bored with my character and lost my pet (which I don't know if you get back)
I played as a guardian and looked like a ♥♥♥♥.
I played with koreans and they made me their ♥♥♥♥♥.
I sat there and thought about my life decisions.

Overall I think this is a good game that can be refined and developed more but you need friends to quench the grind
10/10 would waste life again

reviewText: Echo of Soul is an MMORPG that I have been stuck on for awhile now. The game is addictive! The game has amazing graphics, cool combat mechanics, beautiful scenery, cool-looking characters and of course a world of wonder and mystery to dive into! I'd say this is by far the best MMORPG that I've ever played! Never played WoW or LoL but I can bet that they are not as good or on par with Echo of Soul. The game is near-perfect! There are a few flaws in the game but nothing fundamentally killing its play value. I'd highly recommend this game to anyone who likes good MMORPGs and tactical real-time strategy games.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Solid game.

Upon starting, after customizing my charecter I partied up with 2 other players in the (packed) starting zone. This game is still very active and I saw many new players in the first few areas. I leveled up to 20 with my groupmates this morning and we made a guild together. Everyone I encountered in game was very kind and helpful.

The game seems EXTREMELY well polished, especially for a F2P game. I had low expectations after watching reviews of EOS on MMOs.com and MMOHUT and I was pleasently suprised to find it an allaround  better experiance than many other similar games I have played. (Neverwinter, Perfect World, BnS, STO, Path of Exile to name a few)

This is a great title and really returns to that classic" MMORPG feel
hoursPlayed: and decent graphics.\n\nOf course it playes like many other MMOS (Go here
voteText: kill this
helpfulPercent: repeat) but is a VERY enjoyable experiance especially with a group.\n\nThe classes are gender-locked
votesHelpful:
probably to save time in development. I don't personally mind this but other players who absolutely refuse to play as the opposite gender might dislike this feature. So far I am enjoying playing as the Guardian class.

Overall I would give this game an 8/10.
If you are looking for a revoluionary game with the latest trendy features this is not the one for you. However
votesTotal: if you just want a good all around MMO that ticks all the usual boxes with a few unique features
votesFunny: decent graphics (works on many systems) and fun all around gameplay this is a great choice"
